label: Temperature
info:
Temperature readings, triggered every 2 
seconds (note that the PID algorith has this 
frequency hard coded into it, and those 
functions will need to be modified if the 
trigger frequency is changed). Also smoothing 
and formating for temperature display.

label: BK Buttons
info:
Buttons related to controlling the brew kettle.
These buttons also display state.

label: BK Controller
info:
PID functionality, as well as an interlock 
scheme to prevent multiple elements from being
used at one time.

label: Element Outputs
info:
Routing to GPIO, as well as displays for element
output in duty % and watts.

label: Pump Control
info:
This flow provides a button to turn a pump on 
and off. The colour of the pump button reflects
its status. The pump has one restriction in that 
it can not be turned off while RIMS is active.
Such attempts are blocked, with a notification
provided to the user.

label: UI
info:
This tab contains a collection of UI features.
* CSS overide to ensure dashboard is only 1 or 2 columns
* Centre "group" titles
* Navigation buttons
* Bolts indicating element activity

name: transform options
get batches API call
info:
# Brewfather API URL
https://api.brewfather.app/v1/batches

Node configured to only pull list of batches (no accociated batch data retrieved with this API call).

name: get batch API call
info:
# Brewfather API URL
https://api.brewfather.app/v1/batches/{{payload}}?include=recipe.mash,mashStepsCount,recipe.data.mashFermentablesAmount,recipe.data.strikeTemp,recipe.data.totalWaterAmount

Node configured to pull specified data fields for selected batch.


# Get selected batch (hardcoded)
https://api.brewfather.app/v1/batches/:id

where :id is the _id property from the batch JSON

# Get selected batch (dynamic)
https://api.brewfather.app/v1/batches/{{payload}}

For dynamic http reuests, look at "mustache templates"...
http://www.steves-internet-guide.com/node-red-http-request-node-beginners/
